The two fools [an2.117:1.4]: One who takes responsibility for what has not come to pass
One who doesn’t take responsibility for what has come to pass
One who perceives what is unallowable as allowable
One who perceives what is allowable as unallowable
One who perceives a non-offense as an offense
One who perceives an offense as a non-offense
One who perceives what is not the teaching as the teaching
One who perceives the teaching as not the teaching
One who perceives what is not the training as the training
One who perceives what is the training as not the training
The two who are astute [an2.117:1.4]: One who doesn’t take responsibility for what has not come to pass
One who does take responsibility for what has come to pass
One who perceives what is unallowable as unallowable
One who perceives what is allowable as allowable
One who perceives a non-offense as a non-offense
One who perceives an offense as an offense
One who perceives the teaching as the teaching
One who perceives what is not the teaching as not the teaching
One who perceives what is not the training as not the training
One who perceives what is the training as the training
